Amazing game. Love playing it with my kids!
Really like the freedom and variability that the portal gun gives you to solve the puzzles!

Fantastic game to use as both an introduction to games using the first person perspective, and puzzle games in general. Valve does an excellent job slowly easing you into the game's mechanics, and doesn't throw too much at you at once to where you feel overwhelmed. The game is also connected to the Half-Life lore, though it doesn't really blatantly say it. Although the game is a bit short (3-5 hours), it remains a timeless classic, and the perfect game for people new to games, and still very enjoyable for experienced Gamers.

i've been waiting to play this for years (just never had a machine/space on my laptop to do it), and it was definitely worth the wait. an excellent, mind bending puzzle game that was just short enough to not be tedious but long enough to be satisfying. can't wait to play the sequel!

Still great after all these years. The graphics are a bit dated and you can easily beat it in a single sitting, but great.
I really like the color blue. Orange is okay.
I adore this game--It's challenging and interesting and even after I've finished all the puzzles I still replay it to unwind and relax. All in all, one of my favorite games.
Silly and challenging! Fun aesthetic and sound design, and even gave me the creeps at times. Helped my brain work in different ways.

Short, sweet and kind of eerie. Holds up very well even though there isn't much going on aside from jumping through portals.

A classic that'll get your brain juices movin'.

10/10

This game is honestly really cool and well worth its price. I was really supprised by how entertaining and fun the game actually is. I'm usually a big fan of riddle and puzzle games.. But this takes the prize! I'm sure this game can be enjoyed by most people even if they usually aren't a fan of either puzzles or challenges. I honestly think this would be a fun experience for everyone!

A classic the second it rolled out of Valve's pipeline. Still a must-own for any gamer to this day, and I see no reason why it won't remain the Great Expectations of gaming along with Portal 2 forever. Amazing concept, execution, art, atmosphere. I would recommend (and do recommend) this game to just about anyone.
